channel.title: Building a good eco/pvp server.. How?
channel.description: This has always been an issue with me. I want to make a server that's good on the economy side.. And good on the pvp side too. I'm no genius when it comes to putting them together. Cause you need to make it easy to access pvp gear, and easy to skill, but not to easy to obtain some of the best items. How do you guys put them hand in hand?

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:10, topic:507445”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=625679.msg4258919#msg4258919 date=1363230077]

I always thought to make skill levels 0 - 6 available for anyone to change their combat levels freely from 1 - 99. That way players can earn skilling levels (if they want) and enjoy the game if that’s what they wanted to do. You could also add a few items that cost pk points and make a pk point currency (like the money pouch) that can be accessed and taken-away-from whenever the player decides and placed into a trade window. Additionally you could have NPCs drop pk point items and a few items that can only be gained through killing monsters and put together with skilling (such as crafting 2 item pieces together like 2 shield halves).

I think I’d build my server, so if a player has gotten a level, they can reset to it. So you actually have to achieve 99 in a skill, then you can change the level of it freely by command, so players can actually earn their ranks.
[/quote]

That’s a great idea.[/quote]
can’t tell if sarcasm or not.

item.title: Building a good eco/pvp server.. How?
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

This depends on what route you are willing to approach.
You can have new players join in a tutorial island sort of environment and require them to make their first set of armour and then their first batch of bread or food before they can dwell into the actual PKing world.
You can have your players simply log in with a practical PKing starter and have them level up by fighting other players and neighboring NPCs.
You have have your players earn XP lamps while fighting, which they can either use to the skill of their choice, or have the XP lamps be assigned to certain skills.
An idea I just thought up of with construction is:

  • Players must cut their own logs and bring them to the mill to have them made into planks.
  • Players must mine several metals and smith them to make nails.
  • Players must use a log with a bar of metal to make a hammer.
  • Afterwards, players may begin to create their own PKing rings, where:
    ~ Players can set points for their own rink.
    ~ Players can make use of an NPC running the same concept as player-owned-shops, but they must use the points they earn from that player’s ring to get the items in that shop.

item.title: Building a good eco/pvp server.. How?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:4, topic:507445”]Again, you need to have your server be flexible enough that it can adjust to the many types of PKer’s that there are out there.
Here’s an idea that I’m thinking of:

  • At your home town, there is a group of NPC’s that you can speak with.
  • Speaking with the first one will set your levels to that of a ‘pure.’ You will then be asked if you wish to teleport to the pure’s PKing zone. To stop hoarding and massacre, only other pure’s have access to this area.
  • Do the same for maxed pkers, hybrids, no food PKing, etc.
    Alternatively, you can implement code that will stop another player from getting points if the level difference between the two is too great.[/quote]
    The issue with adding that, is I want to have the economy/skilling side behind the server too. I want the levels to be something achieved, but not achieved too hard or too easily. I don’t want runescape’s xp rates, but I don’t want an instant pk server. Some kids will get bored of that.
    But again, the idea of ranked pk zones sounds great. I might do a split of ranked and un-ranked. Of course, you get more points in unranked, as you can fight virtually anyone there (with the limits of level difference +/- 40ish).

item.title: Building a good eco/pvp server.. How?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:507445”]Make your players work for it, while still providing the motivation for them to continue doing so.
Key factors such as:

  • The player’s taste in PK’ing
  • Economy:PVP ratio
  • Access to spawning
  • What levels are important,
    play into a server like this.
    Motivation-wise, there should be some sort of achievement, be it an item, a yell title, a specialized PK’ing zone, that should be at some point accessible to all.
    This would bring me to my next point; donators/members. Members should not be able to have access to superior items in a PK’ing server, in my opinion. If they did, new players and old alike would lose motivation because of an ‘elite PKer’ roaming around the wilderness. Give them an increased percentage of PK points per kill, or maybe allow them to have a point-free member’s PK’ing zone.
    Recently, point shops have become popular, yet they only play their part in a short term span. Once players have access to these items, they find themselves losing the motivation to keep on earning them.
    You should definitely invest some time in periodic promotion events. These could be double-point weekends, PK’ing tournaments that reward, say, an ‘Elite Pker’ player title, or Bring-a-Friend events. With something to look forward to, players find themselves willing to stick around and see what fun event the administration might hold in store for them.[/quote]
    I will definitely look into your ideas of events and such, I really think it’d be helpful.
    I agree with you 100% on the donor/member item access. My server does indeed have a donation system, but I will never give out items that give an advantage as such to my donors. They get cosmetics, and maybe some items that increase xp or rewards and such. Nothing that can damage the overall economy.

I guess my biggest issue here, is I’m not a pk’er, nor was I ever interested in it. So I don’t know what players like that want. I’ve been a main-maxer-character type of guy. One that wants to conquer everything possible, and earn all the rewards. Not kill others and loot.
